summary: Change out casting and repair sidewalk panel

We would love to have an additional circle/post bike rack in front of our office at 335 Broadway in Cambridge. The two posts we already have get a lot of use and, when full, people often resort to locking their bikes on the street-parking signs.

Driver is reporting a bicycle attached to a handicapped sign.  It has been abandoned for about 3 months.  It is difficult to exit the vehicle with this bicycle interfering.

I head down Broadway (from Harvard to Kendall) every morning somewhere between 8.30-9am.  Over the past few months, the backup on Broadway has been getting worse and worse: yesterday traffic was at a standstill in front of the library, and it took more the 15 minutes to get to Prospect St.  After Prospect, smooth sailing.  It would be great if the timing of the light signals could be re-examined for rush hour times to try to keep traffic flowing a bit better.  Thank you.
Can tree be repaired?  It has a wound that is being attacked by ants.
Electric wires hanging in backyard
Splash pad at Sennott not working.
This mailbox is covered in graffiti. The amount of graffiti in central square is increasing dramatically. Please address it promptly
This is actually the parking lot next to St. Barts Church which has asked that we not forget to plow the parking lot.

Sunken water access (about 5" down, 6" across) in northbound broadway bike lane a few feet after the intersection. It's a fairly difficult intersection to bike normally; this adds to the difficulty as it occurs just before bicyclists need to merge with traffic.

Need a small plow for a side street.  Maybe can be scheduled with the recent request for King Place?

For Pedestrians walking down Prospect St. toward Central Square, right in front of this house is a large tree with many low hanging branches.  There is a bit of a "tunnel" to walk through, but it really should be cut back/ cut up higher.  Please put it on the list to trim the branches of this tree

The rainwater drain in front of 331 Broadway is so choked with old leaves and seed pods that it does not drain. Mere street-sweeping doesn't help this problem. The stoppage will have to be cleared manually, with metal tools.

I have the following requests:1. a tree on my side walk recently cut by the public work because it die. It would be nice if I could have a replacement tree planted. 2. If I may, i would like to request a Ginkgo(male) tree or Red Maple to be the replacement tree. It would add some color to my street. 3. If it possible, would you plant more trees along my street since there is no tree from 15 Tremont st  to the the end of corner of tremont and 305 Broadway at all. Can I also request Ginkgo(male) or Red Maple so it could enhance the beauty of my street ! thanks.wendy Shieh at 13 Tremont st. Cambridge

The wheel on one of our large Toters (95-gallon) broke off during recycling pick-up today.  Would you please send someone to pick-up the broken toter and replace it with a new one.  The broken toter was left by the curbside.

Resident reports a defect about 16" deep under the pavement along with lots of cracks.  This area was patched about a year ago, but the defect is deep underneath the sidewalk.  The hole has significantly increased in size over the past week.   See the resident photo.

This sidewalk remains uncleared.  Someone slipped and fell and has had to go to the hospital.  It needs to have some salt or sand sprinkled to make it less treacherous.  Some immediate attention is needed.

Typically our collection is Thursday, but with the Thanksgiving delay we expected yard waste pickup this morning. Our neighbors had their yard waste picked up, but ours was missed. Thank you.

You need to re-engineer how the bikes come across prospect at Broadway and Prospect Street, right now the pinch keeps pinging bikes into the rear of the parked cars, putting in a bike lane giving a delayed signal, putting the bikes in the center as opposed to off to the side make much more sense

When walking down Prospect from Broadway towards Mass Ave, the pedestrian signal is not fully working. The red hand appears, the numbers appear, but the white walking person does not appear. this is on the same side of the street as Whole Foods.

"9-11-00 was my murder date from here." Spray painted on the side walk behind the mosque on Tremont street - The mosque is on Prospect, the back side is Tremont. I'm not sure what it means but it seems nefarious and hateful.

Been abandoned a year

Before street improvements, there was a "no left turn" sign hanging with the traffic signal in the center lane of Mass Ave at the point that the far left lane is designated "left turn only".  I drive this route daily and want to turn left and move immediately into the right lane to be positioned for the Broadway branch.  Some drivers in the center lane which should be straight ahead only, make a left turn instead.  If the "no left turn" sign were returned to hang on the traffic standard, they would know they should not turn left from the center lane.  Thank you for addressing this problem.
Tree appears to have been hit by a vehicle.  A damaged tree branch, partially attached, is lying on the sidewalk.

Resident witnessed Cambridge Landscaping Company remove snow from neighbors house and pile into street, sidewalk and gutter.  She feels this is dangerous.  It also hinders walking, placing trash and recycle barrels out and wants to know if this is a violation.  There are mounds of snow Cambridge Landscaping has pushed into the street and onto curb.

Charles Gibson, father of John Gibson, the Capitol Police officer shot and killed in Washington in 1998. He says someone tampered with and removed a street sign memorializing John. It’s on the corner of Tremont and Broadway in Cambridge. He said somebody  leaned it against a nearby fence.
Silver schwinn with pink handlebar tape 311 Broadway

Hello - I am wondering if the left side of Inman St will be cleared anytime soon. It has not been cleared since the lifting of the parking Ban on Friday. Inman is a busy st, and people tend to park there who don't live there during the day which leaves residents of inman out of luck. With the snow bank we have less than half our normal parking. Help!! Thank you :)

Most nights during the past two weeks there has been at least one homeless person sleeping outside in the little park area outside of the city hall annex building on Broadway and Inman Streets at night.  Today there was a female sleeping there as early as 625pm.  at least one time the homeless person got angry with me for speaking quietly to my dog when telling it not to bother and bark at this person.  Is it legal to sleep out there?  I know shelters are probably full and not very pleasant or safe but at least could help get them set up with medical care and on housing lists.  Sleeping outside doesn't seem very safe either.

I have hanging wires (telephone? Electric?) in my back yard and I'm not sure who to call to get them removed. Neither NSTAR nor AT&T seem to be taking any responsibility. They don't appear to be live, but they also don't appear to be safe. Can someone help us?

On the corner of Inman and West the plows have dumped a 5 foot pile of snow blocking the curb cut so people can't cross the street. It's especially dangerous for anyone with mobility difficulties of vision impairment as there's no where safe for them to cross.  Thanks for looking into this!

There are a lot of cigarette butts along the paved pathway near the field at Sennot Park. My child likes to run and play around there so please clean it up. It's really gross and unsafe for kids.
